instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.message:
So i don't know what i did. have a 820-3115 that had a bad hard drive. computer was booting up but stuck apple logo halfway on startup. checked the hard drive, diagnosied it bad so i upgrade to ssd and transfer the data with my data recovery equipment. i plug in the ssd today and now i only get fan spin for about 5 minutes until i finally get a chime and mbp will boot up either with old hard drive or new one.


only thing i noticed is that ppbus starts at 11.5v and slowly creeps up to 12 when it finally boots.
Did you try several new SATA/HDD cables? Big issue on the 3115 units, of course.

you think its the cable? usually if bad cable itll chime but no boot. this isn't even chiming till 4-5 minutes

replaced cable.  same issue

Bad cable can manifest in many ways. I didn't see you mention it, so wanted to rule it out first.

Delayed chime could be a BIOS issue. Can you try a new BIOS? You can hot-swap a chip over for testing purposes (only!). If chime is normal, then load up a clean BIOS on the old chip. If issue persists, try a new chip. If issue still persists, then move onto next possible cause. Delayed chime by 5 minutes is odd, but I'd start with BIOS.

Disconnect HHD cable and check if machine works good.
If not, then clean ME.
okay weird one here.  i swapped the bios turned on fast.  put it back together and 5 minute chime.  one by one i connected and its the super drive that is causing this.
i replaced the super drive and is still causing long chime times.  any particular line i should check or just check them all?
Compare diode for all pins to working board; easiest way. See if any are significantly (5-8%+) different in value.
